columns.text: In this exercise, we will calculate the number of payments required to reach the account balance of $15,000 if the monthly payment is $175 with 7% interest which compounds monthly.

We will consider the following data in solving the problem:

| Particulars      |         |
|------------------|---------|
| Constant payment | $175    |
| Rate             | 7%      |
| Future value   | $15,000 |

To determine the number of payments to an investment, we will use the NPER spreadsheet function.

The NPER is a spreadsheet function that calculates the number of periods required in an investment or loan based on the future value, rate, and constant payment. The NPER function can be calculated using the following formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
NPER&=(\text{rate},pmt,pv,[fv],[type]) \\
\end{aligned}$$


Where:


$pmt$, which represent the constant payment\
$pv$, which means the present value\
$fv$, which refers to the future value\
$type$, which indicates the basis of the calculation, either year-end or beginning of the year

Next, let's now calculate the number of periods using the spreadsheet. Note that the future value should be negative for the function to work correctly.

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/e02fabe4-9707-4376-8af6-9f2b01b0ec82-1642181183456640.png)

**Based on our calculation, as can be seen above the number of periods required to reach the $15,000 account balance is 70.**

To conclude, the number of periods can be calculated using the NPER spreadsheet function; it determines the number of periods of an investment based on the rate, the constant payment amount, and future value.
